course.subject: ENVR
course.name: A Systems Approach to Emerging Environmental Technologies I
course.description: This course introduces to students a set of coherent analytical tools such as Technology Delivery System (TDS), Map of Science, Economic and Market Analysis, Risks and Impacts Assessment, Cost & Benefit Analysis, Epidemic Diffusion Model, Innovation Pathways etc. to help to develop a systems approach to manage the development and deployment of emerging environmental technologies.  Students form teams to integrate these and other frameworks and conduct a future-oriented policy analysis of an emerging technology which addresses environmental & climate change and sustainable development. This is the first part of a two-semester sequel project course. Instructor's approval is required for enrollment in the course.
